language:
<entry name="Agent0Description" value=""Mata Hari? The spy? I've never heard of her. But if I had, I would never admit it."
-- Itala Palomino, A Child's Guide to Espionage
Most factions call their spies attachés or military advisors or diplomatic aides - but they're spies all the same. On Pandora, though all the factions are unified in their mutual friendship and trust, we thought it wise to revive this oldest of professions. Use them discreetly and wisely."/> <entry name="Agent0Properties" value="Light biological unit
Can infiltrate cities
Cannot flank
Cannot capture cities or ruins"/>
<entry name="Agent1Description" value=""It's a very sad thing that nowadays there is so little useless information."
-- Oscar Wilde
Our agents may have had all the wiles of the old world, but they were traditional types, using sad little pistols and blackbagging each other outside embassies. Our new agents, though as capable as their predecessors at the Le Carré style of espionage, have wetware interfaces and all sorts of hidden extras."/> <entry name="Agent1Properties" value="Light biological unit
Can infiltrate cities
Cannot flank
Cannot capture cities or ruins"/>
<entry name="Agent2Description" value=""If our memories are hard drives, our eyes satellites and our hands machines a thousand miles distant... what do we care if someone's watching? They're probably just another part of us."
-- Itala Palomino
It's hard to talk about our third generation agents... because they're always listening. We assume that they're still working for us, wherever or whatever they are, because parcels of enemy data keep unlocking in my terminal. But they've moved so far past human now that communication with them is like talking to angels. It's a blessing that they still appear to be, mostly on our side."/> <entry name="Agent2Properties" value="Light biological unit
Can infiltrate cities
Cannot flank
Cannot capture cities or ruins"/>
<entry name="Aircraft0Description" value=""Fight on and fly on to the last drop of blood and the last drop of fuel, to the last beat of the heart."
-- Baron Manfred von Richthofen
The problem of flight in Pandora's unreliable atmosphere has been solved. Gaseous fuel is ionized and fed into an acceleration chamber containing magnetic and electrical fields, where particles are propelled through the exhaust chamber by the Lorentz force. This produces an exhaust velocity of up to and beyond 10,000 meters per second, allowing smaller airborne vessels with a limited power source to evolve into fast and agile fighters."/> <entry name="Aircraft0Properties" value="Airborne light mechanical unit
+25% power vs ground units on plains
Cannot flank
Cannot capture cities or ruins"/>
<entry name="Aircraft1Properties" value="Airborne light mechanical unit
+25% power vs ground units on plains
Cannot flank
Cannot capture cities or ruins"/>
<entry name="Aircraft2Properties" value="Airborne light mechanical unit
+25% power vs ground units on plains
Cannot flank
Cannot capture cities or ruins"/>
<entry name="AlienAircraftProperties" value="Airborne light mechanical unit
+25% power vs ground units on plains
Cannot capture cities or ruins"/>
<entry name="AlienArtilleryProperties" value="Heavy mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="AlienMechProperties" value="Heavy mechanical unit
Not affected by roads
Cannot perform orbital deployment"/>
<entry name="AlienMothershipDescription" value="This city-sized drifting disc is the ultimate expression of the Messari field technology. Unlike the shrieking rending of their other diffusion weapons, the hole at the centre of the torus is silent -- indeed, sound seems unable to escape it at all. Anything else the disc passes over simply evaporates.
Our only blessing is that the thing can't move any faster than a march, else we'd already have lost."/> <entry name="AlienMothershipProperties" value="Airborne light mechanical unit
+25% power vs ground units on plains
Cannot capture cities or ruins"/>
<entry name="AlienTankProperties" value="Heavy mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="AlienTransportProperties" value="Waterborne heavy mechanical unit
Transports land units
Cannot attack"/>
<entry name="AlienTrooperDescription" value="These foot-soldiers of the alien invasion look almost human -- bipedal and simian. However, given that we've never captured one alive or even managed to penetrate their armor, we can't tell if they're the aliens themselves, some servitor race, or even just a cruel mockery of the human form.
They might be the weakest Messari unit, but they come in their hundreds and they're still lethally effective."/> <entry name="AlienTrooperProperties" value="Light biological unit"/>
<entry name="AspidochProperties" value="Heavy biological unit
+50% power when defending"/>
<entry name="ATV0Description" value="Despite the similarities between Pandora and old Earth, tweaking properties like mass and moment of inertia for a light reconnaissance vehicle can mean the difference between life and death to its driver. The reported top speed for certain Xenomorph species is above 150 miles per hour, so that in military circles exploration duty has become a much-feared punishment for disobedience.
Roger Raynor and his seeker trike are legendary among explorers, his adventures often told in bars and at campfires: How he outwitted the great Galeth by driving in circles, how he stole Vermillion's golden scarab by escaping through the Sea of Grass, and how he tried to outrun a pack of black Xenomorphs. The story, sadly, ends there."/> <entry name="ATV0Properties" value="Light mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="ATV1Properties" value="Light mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="ATV2Properties" value="Light mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="Bug0Properties" value="Light biological unit"/>
<entry name="BugQueenProperties" value="Heavy biological unit
+50% power when defending"/>
<entry name="ColonizerProperties" value="Heavy mechanical unit
Consumes a colonist
Builds new cities
Cannot attack"/>
<entry name="CrabProperties" value="Amphibious light biological unit
+50% power in water territories"/>
<entry name="FlyerProperties" value="Airborne light biological unit
+25% power vs ground units on plains"/>
<entry name="FormerProperties" value="Heavy mechanical unit
Improves terrain
Cannot attack"/>
<entry name="Former1Properties" value="Amphibious heavy mechanical unit
Improves terrain
Cannot attack"/>
<entry name="GiantProperties" value="Heavy biological unit
+50% power vs undefended cities"/>
<entry name="LeviathanProperties" value="Heavy biological unit"/>
<entry name="Mech0Description" value="The tank, our current heaviest war machine, is restricted in size due to limitations in maneuvering on Pandora's rough terrain. Finally the time has come for a new era of mechanization.
The Goliath is a gigantic humanoid war machine with a total weight of over a hundred thousand tons, as much as the largest Earth aircraft carrier. It can carry enough firepower to engage whole armies and equip even the heaviest weapon modules."/> <entry name="Mech0Properties" value="Heavy mechanical unit
Not affected by roads
Cannot perform orbital deployment"/>
<entry name="Mech1Properties" value="Heavy mechanical unit
Not affected by roads
Cannot perform orbital deployment"/>
<entry name="Mech2Properties" value="Heavy mechanical unit
Not affected by roads
Cannot perform orbital deployment"/>
<entry name="NightcrawlerProperties" value="Amphibious heavy biological unit
+50% power in water territories"/>
<entry name="NingenProperties" value="Amphibious heavy biological unit
+50% power in water territories"/>
<entry name="QueenFlyerProperties" value="Airborne heavy biological unit
+25% power vs ground units on plains"/>
<entry name="SharkProperties" value="Waterborne light biological unit"/>
<entry name="SpitterBugProperties" value="Heavy biological unit"/>
<entry name="Tank0Description" value="Transporting war machinery from Earth was prohibitively expensive but we need equipment to defend ourselves against the planet's dangerous lifeforms and other factions. With that in mind, we've designed a modified version of mankind's most feared field weapon: the tank.
As dispensers of death and destruction, tanks often had the last word on the Earth battlefield. On top of adaptations to Pandora's gravity and terrain, they can be configured with several different types of turrets.
"Roll over them.""/> <entry name="Tank0Properties" value="Heavy mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="Tank1Properties" value="Heavy mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="Tank2Description" value="Over the past decades our understanding of the man-machine interface has progressed significantly, but only by studying the largest alien creatures have we finally mastered the technology of an organic interface. The Liberator is a complete symbiosis between man and machine and terrifyingly deadly.
"Tell me, Commander, how does it feel to become one with your tank?"
"Liberating.""/> <entry name="Tank2Properties" value="Heavy mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="TransportProperties" value="Waterborne heavy mechanical unit
Transports a land unit
Cannot attack
Cannot be produced"/>
<entry name="Trooper0Description" value="The first line of defense in most battles and trained for a variety of combat scenarios, Colonial Troopers are the backbone of modern armies.
"Give me ten troopers and a week, and I will change the course of history.""/> <entry name="Trooper0Properties" value="Light biological unit"/>
<entry name="Trooper1Description" value="Mobile, agile and highly armored, Assault Troopers are the soldier of the future. The reinforced full body suit can withstand a considerable onslaught, but grants the wearer quite responsive motor control.
When field tested in a city warfare scenario, a young lieutenant named Wilkins, last of his squad, took out three enemy Avenger tanks by himself. The story spread like wildfire through the ranks, and "pulling a Wilkins" has become a synonym for bucking the odds."/> <entry name="Trooper1Properties" value="Light biological unit"/>
<entry name="Trooper1ShockProperties" value="Light biological unit"/>
<entry name="Trooper2Properties" value="Light biological unit"/>
<entry name="Watercraft0Properties" value="Waterborne heavy mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="Watercraft1Properties" value="Waterborne heavy mechanical unit"/>
<entry name="Watercraft2Properties" value="Waterborne heavy mechanical unit"/>
